comment: Yes, Dr. Thomas is not organized. It is extremely frustrating because she is also not very accessible. But I got a lot out of the class; the readings and films we considered were interesting and not overwhelming (no essays, tysm Dr. T). Her feedback (when she finally got around to it) was not very detailed but felt fair. I would take her again.
I enjoyed this class and would take it again. The only problem I had was the way she would grade our assignments because there no grading system on her syllabus.

This class should be Trauma Theory; that's all we learned about. Thomas is not punctual; she was slow in responding to emails and uploading assignments. Many of her materials were riddled with errors, especially her schedule. You can sparknotes your way through this class, it's based on reflection posts. She did replace our exams with a project tho

I LOVE Dr.T. Shes a very sweet person whos passionate about what she does! This class consisted of 12 quizzes, 1 intro DP, a mandatory AADS student conference, a midterm DP, and a final DP. As long as you read the assigned materials you should be able to pass the quizzes. Offered lots of extra credit towards the end of the semester. Choose her!!

I knew that before I took her class that reviews said she was unorganized. This is very true nonetheless. But its really not hard shes just unclear but I or one of my classmates would email her and she would resolve it. Quizzes were easy but written response was a bit challenging. I exempted the final. Got a B! Also is slow with uploading quizzes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: My classmates were dumb and had no idea what was going on, but I do not put the blame solely on them. We had her disappear for 2 weeks and had no communication from her. It was easy and straightforward, if you dont read of course youre gonna fail. We had a test every week based off of an avg of 3 readings. Dont like to read? Dont take her!

I'm not sure about her physical class but in her online class, she is very unorganized. I have three quizzes that had a free response that she hasn't graded yet. Oh and also she has like 10 readings for like a 5 question quiz. Her communication is not that great. Overall, don't recommend it.

I took her online AADS 1101 class, she was unorganized to say the least, but the class itself was very easy. One 5-10 question quiz each week (usually 5 true or false), and she uploads a powerpoint to go along with it. Midterm and Final were just recycled quiz questions.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: the class itself was really amazing but she is a bit unorganized. she might and most definitely will change so many things last minute. besides that she is really nice and wants us to learn. there are quizzes due every week but they are really easy, midterm, and them final group project. Take her!

Her background is not in film and its annoying because obviously when signing up for a film class that is something you expect. Because of this it made the class extremely unenjoyable. would not recommend if youre taking her for any type of film class. perhaps an english class.

Dr. Thomas is one of those professors you will either love or hate. She's passionate about her teaching and she can be brutally honest. Yes, she does take attendance. She doesn't give A LOT of work, but she does make you work when assignments come up. We had a midterm paper (4 pages) & a final presentation. Great professor overall.

professor thomas is super smart and really passionate about what she does. she's a great professor. take any of her classes; you won't regret it. there were 3 papers, 2 tests, and a lot of (good) reading. guest speakers, great discussions. the class was just awesome. really a must take.
Just take the Lady. You'll leave her class feeling more enlightened and blessed to have met her. She's highly intelligent, funny and cool which all makes a good combination for a class.

She is awesome because she does a power point then we will have an open discussion about each test topic. So it helps people who do not read the material to review and it helps the people who did read to have different viewpoints. She is very scatterbrained though and very unorganized so as long as you can be patient, I recommend this class.

Yes, she is disorganized a bit and we do a good bit of reading, but still a VERY easy class! Take notes, attend, and pay attention and you will make an A. Great teacher who expects college students NOT lazy children!

She is fantastic! I had her in World Lit. & when I needed 3 credits in Cultural studies, taking her again was a no-brainer! This is Blues Legacies & Black Feminism. We read a total of 5 books, saw 2 films, wrote 2 papers, and did 1 presentation, attendance mandatory, but NO tests! She is very approachable, and helpful at all times. Take her!
She is awesome! Her class is pretty easy as long as you do the assigned reading. She is very nice and easy to talk to, and she has a great sense of humor. Loved her class! I highly recommend her!
Most straight forward teacher I have met. No surprises or tricks up her sleeves, just solid teaching. Very lenient teacher and as long as you attempt to work in her class you will do just fine.

Super knowledgeable but still down to earth. She will get pissed if the class blows off reading assignments more than once. Not the harshest grader, but can spot a bs-er quickly. Opinionated, personable, funny, engaging. Don't cheat, she will catch you. Great professor would definitely take her again.
Amazing teacher I love her!!! TAKE CLASS!!

Dr Thomas is Awesome!!! The books she assigns are interesting and diverse. In her group discussions she respects you opinion even if it differs from hers. And her test are easy as long as you take notes and attend the lecture and group discussions.. TAKE HER!! You will not be disappointed

Professor Thomas is amazing. She picks interesting books for her classes, and makes them available to students who cannot afford all of them. Her tests are straightforward and she allows you to debate on dropping questions if they aren't fair. She grades fairly on her short essays that are required for the class.

Dr. Thomas is amazing. The class isn't hard, and she's extremely fair and helpful. You can miss 2 classes. I had her for summer and we wrote two papers and did a group presentation, plus 3 or 4 tests and a few quizzes. We read 4 books, 3 of which were extremely short. Seriously, take her, you won't be disappointed :) Great teacher.

Class was wonderful. Yes, her PhD is in African American studies, but she is straightforward about this in the beginning of the semester. I think she's gotten the message from past students and was careful to include other works. Extremely intelligent and really wants you to 100% engage yourself in the material. You must enjoy literary analysis!

The class was pretty straight forward, 1 quiz on each book, 2 short movie reviews, and 2 tests. However, on the tests and quizzes, pay attention, she tends to make at least one mistake per exam. If you don't pay attention and catch them she cannot add points back to your quiz. She is very laid back and will sometimes move due dates back if asked.

This class was supposed to be about American Lit. All we learned about was African American Lit. Although that may be an interesting topic,that is not what i paid for. She focused too much on racism in EVERY work we studied. It didn't matter if racism was a major theme or not, she found a way to incorporate it. Do not advise anyone to take the clas

You must read and comprehend every book that is discussed. The class discussions provide a better understanding, so it is imperative to attend class. If you read the books and come to class you can easily get a good grade.

This professor is a funny, wonderful person but is extremely disorganized. The reading load is very heavy and she asks specific details from 50 pg readings. You have to print A LOT for class. She requires extra reading that isnt relevant to the test and the study guides are only somewhat helpful. I wouldnt recommend her for this course.

This is a great class to take, if you require world lit.  She gives excellent notes, invites truly open discussion, and practically gives you the answers to exams questions in class.  Very lenient on grading - I had not written a paper in 15 years and made 100s on all my essays. She is very knowledgeable and passionate about the material.

I really enjoyed Dr. Thomas as a person- she's a sweet lady, and funny. She was not incredibly clear on her expectations from us, but I'm sure that's partly because she's new. Even though most of what we read involved AfroAmerican history or slavery, the books were interesting and the class was doable. i ended up with an A.

The books we read we pretty interesting. She hardly makes you write any papers. I think I wrote two. Takes attendace but is not strict about it. Class is sometimes boring but can sometimes be interesting. I would recommend taking it. Easy A.

Some people thought she was hard, but if you're a good writer and you do the reading assignments you can't go wrong.  American lit survey isn't really her thing (her Ph.D. is in African American studies) but she did the best she could.  As a teacher she's okay(slow with grading and not extremely clear with tests)but as a person she's funny and nice

I think I felt sorry for Dr. Thomas at the beginning of the year. She said she was new to KSU. The students walked all over her! She does take attendance and requires essays with every test and a 5-7 page essay at the end. The material to be tested over is not clearly marked. She does take a long time to grade things and to post items on WebCT.
